meanings.sent1: She had to procure a rare book for her research project.
meanings.sent2: He managed to procure a ticket to the sold-out concert.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to procure the key to unlock the mystery.
meanings.sent4: With determination, she was able to procure the last piece of the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: After much searching, he finally managed to procure the elusive treasure.

meanings.definition: Bring about or achieve (something) by care or effort.
meanings.sent1: The team worked together to procure a successful outcome.
meanings.sent2: Through hard work, they were able to procure a positive change in the community.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to procure a spectacular illusion for the show.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership skills helped procure a harmonious atmosphere in the workplace.
meanings.sent5: Their joint efforts managed to procure a remarkable transformation in the project.
